bug.author: benallard
bug.description:
Describe the bug The auto-update plugins keeps rebooting my gotchi (once an hour), but doesn't update it. To Reproduce
Install older image give internet to your gotchi see it reboot again and again ... again and again ...
Expected behavior Reboot once, enjoy the new stuff.

comments.comment: Pretty sure everyone is having this issue, me included

Same problem in 1.3.0 Error log on update :
[2019-12-21 13:37:09,525] [WARNING] update for evilsocket/pwnagotchi available (local version is '1.3.0'): https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/archive/v1.4.2.zip [2019-12-21 13:37:11,251] [INFO] [update] downloading https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/archive/v1.4.2.zip to /tmp/updates/pwnagotchi/pwnagotchi_1.4.2.zip ... sh: 0: getcwd() failed: No such file or directory Could not install packages due to an EnvironmentError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
[2019-12-21 13:37:32,028] [INFO] [update] extracting /tmp/updates/pwnagotchi/pwnagotchi_1.4.2.zip to /tmp/updates/pwnagotchi ...
1.3.0 is known to have an update-bug. But I thought 1.4.1 is fine :/

Hmm, funny you should mention that, I have experienced update problems on 1.4.1 too, mentioned in my comment on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/issues/731#issuecomment-568242913>#731</denchmark-link> , but I'm not sure if it's the same issue as described here. Anyway, I stopped services by systemd and updated all components manually as a workaround.
Having update problems too, just won't update from 1.4.1 to 1.4.2. Had the same problem with 1.3.0.
Manual update work fine from 1.3.0 to 1.4.2

Looks like it needs to do some version checking on that line 214 in
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/pwnagotchi/plugins/default/auto-update.py
https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/blob/master/pwnagotchi/plugins/default/auto-update.py
instead of just
if num_installed > 0:
<denchmark-code>def on_internet_available(self, agent): . . if num_installed > 0: display.update(force=True, new_data={'status': 'Rebooting ...'}) pwnagotchi.reboot()
except Exception as e: logging.error("[update] %s" % e) </denchmark-code>
So, I think it's fixed, if not we will reopen.
